result.execSummary:
The defendant Laroy L Hunter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample unless previously submitted.  Pay DNA surcharge, all costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failuer to pay  by end of ES will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED/HSED and participate in vocational training and coginitive thinking class.
Attend parenting class.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No illegal drugs.
No contact with any place drugs are sold, packaged or used.
No controlled substances without prescription.  If defendant has a prescription, he is to report it to his agent.
Successfully complete an anger management/ Batterers intervention program.
AODA assessment.  Comply with treatment or counseling deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession, voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laroy L Hunter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 623.  jew

Defendant Laroy L Hunter in court with attorney Thomas J Erickson.  Defendant Laroy L Hunter in custody.  Denis Stingl on behalf of Karyn Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 15. Case set for plea hearing. Parties are ready to proceed.
Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNT 1-
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Attorney Thomas J Erickson in court, defendant Laroy L Hunter not in court, in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant had been moved to Dodge and defense counsel needs to talk with him. Case recheduled for PROJECTED PLEA on 5/8/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Attorney Thomas J. Erickson in court, defendant Laroy L Hunter not in court, in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 4/24/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Laroy L Hunter in court with attorney Thomas J. Erickson.  Defendant Laroy L Hunter in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Laroy L Hunter in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Defendant Laroy L Hunter in custody.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
